testsuite.name: au.edu.uq.smartass.question.ArithmeticSequenceNthTermModuleTest
testsuite.system-out: \begin{align*} a_n&=a+(n-1)d,\text{ where }d=6-2=4\text{ and }a=2.\\ \text{Therefore }a_{40}&=2+(40-1)\cdot4\\ &=2+39\cdot4\\ &=158 \end{align*} $158$ Let $2,6,10$ be the first three terms of a finite arithmetic sequence. Determine the $40$th term in the sequence.
